Description: Red glazed terracotta shabti of the Wʿb Priest Menkheper with painted detail: a lappet-wig, a modelled face with eyes traced in black and crossed hands in relief holding two small black hoes and two small black seed-bags connected by a cord; the front of the leg section is inscribed with part of Chapter 6 of The Book of The Dead in five rows of black painted Hieroglyphs.
Condition: fair - damage to head and foot
